abstract: Berkshire Hathaway, the giant conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett, said on Thursday that it would buy the H. J. Heinz Company for about $23 billion. Berkshire is teaming up with 3G Capital, a Brazilian investment firm that already owns most of Burger King.
snippet: Berkshire Hathaway, the giant conglomerate run by Warren E. Buffett, said on Thursday that it would buy the H. J. Heinz Company for about $23 billion. Berkshire is teaming up with 3G Capital, a Brazilian investment firm that already owns most of B...

headline.main: Berkshire and 3G Capital in a $23 Billion Deal for Heinz
headline.print_headline: Berkshire and 3G Capital Buying Heinz for $23 Billion

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: When Berkshire Hathaway agreed to buy the H.J. Heinz Company on Thursday, the deal had some of the classic hallmarks of Warren E. Buffett. Here is a look at some of Berkshire’s deals in recent years.
snippet: When Berkshire Hathaway agreed to buy the H.J. Heinz Company on Thursday, the deal had some of the classic hallmarks of Warren E. Buffett. Here is a look at some of Berkshire’s deals in recent years.
lead_paragraph: When Berkshire Hathaway agreed to buy the H.J. Heinz Company on Thursday, the deal had some of the classic hallmarks of Warren E. Buffett.

headline.main: With Heinz Deal, an ‘Elephant’ for Berkshire

abstract: The sale of H.J. Heinz to Berkshire Hathaway and 3G Capital is big in many ways — the headline price of $23 billion, for one. But one notable fact is that most of the banks putting the deal together aren’t bulge-bracket firms.
snippet: The sale of H.J. Heinz to Berkshire Hathaway and 3G Capital is big in many ways — the headline price of $23 billion, for one. But one notable fact is that most of the banks putting the deal together aren’t bulge-bracket firms.
lead_paragraph: The sale of H.J. Heinz to Berkshire Hathaway and 3G Capital is big in many ways — the headline price of $23 billion, for one. But one notable fact is that most of the banks putting the deal together aren’t bulge-bracket firms.

headline.main: Heinz: A Bonanza for Independent Advisers

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Teaming up with private equity might turn out to be a combination that works as well as ketchup on a Whopper.
snippet: Teaming up with private equity might turn out to be a combination that works as well as ketchup on a Whopper.
lead_paragraph: Heinz ketchup is giving markets a taste of private equity’s new secret sauce.

headline.main: In Heinz Takeover, a New Path for Deals

abstract: The buyout deal for Heinz will turn it into a much riskier company that will have to operate with a much larger amount of debt on its books.
snippet: The buyout deal for Heinz will turn it into a much riskier company that will have to operate with a much larger amount of debt on its books.
lead_paragraph: Warren E. Buffett deployed his avuncular charm on Thursday when talking about Berkshire Hathaway’s proposed acquisition of H.J. Heinz. The food company’s chief executive, William R. Johnson, said the deal was a natural next step that wouldn’t lead to big upheavals any time soon.
